9A6E84031960450094D8E2DEFB6B1D84.description: Delight and wonder through the reading of creative, sound, and healthy stories, plays and poems.

04160462A8D545AF9A071ED70FB3297D.description:
Display a sense of the “good” by examining the degree in which characters significantly possess or lack the
perfections proper to a) their nature as human persons, b) their proper role in society as understood in their own culture or the world of the text, c) the terms of contemporary culture, and d) the terms of Catholic tradition and
moral norms.

7DDE7A02FF1842F7959836C28BF6F4DB.description:
Share how literature ignites the creative imagination by presenting in rich context amazing lives and situations
told by humanity’s best storytellers and most alive intellects.

45A366FC98214751B79B78471F0E345E.description:
Identify with beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and
radiance of form.

BA808CD364A748AC84113F2CE0AFDD22.description:
Display the virtues and values evident within stories that involve an ideal and take a stand for love, faith, courage,
fidelity, truth, beauty, goodness, and all virtues.

EA7C85A7348A4005952016DE2CC46A9E.description:
Develop empathy, care, and compassion for a character’s crisis or choice in order to transcend oneself, build virtue,
and better understand one’s own disposition and humanity.

BEC38A34258F4E89A1F08806C0B674BE.description: Share how literature fosters both prudence and sound judgment in the human person.

1A456142350341FEAD906615065A1A7B.description: Demonstrate the use of effective rhetorical skills in the service and pursuit of truth.

04E87F0A0AE64E05BBC10362DC8739B3.description: Use grammar as a means of signifying concepts and the relationship to reason.

C52EC819FAA4481BA39AA1E5D48685E9.description:
Write in various ways to naturally order thoughts to the truth with an accurate expression of intent, knowledge,
and feelings.

5DF4CFE065B34098A7FED00E22450519.description: Explain how language can be used as a bridge for communion with others for the betterment of all involved.

5857913FCD2F414DBEA994F657E64EB7.description:
Describe how the gratuitousness of literary and artistic creation reflects the divine prerogative. Explain the role of
man as “maker”—as artist, poet, and creator—and how the use of language to create is reflective of our being made
in the image and likeness of God.

B9B08BC8AB0C4C81A02B97BE48865235.description: Analyze the author’s reasoning and discover the author’s intent.

CDDFA3DEAFBD4AC1AD8F2DFD06594056.description:
Explain how the powerful role of poetic knowledge, the moral imagination, connotative language, and artistic
creativity explore difficult and unwieldy elements of the human condition, which is not always explainable with
technical linguistic analysis or scientific rationalism.

2EB940876F834B6296524E1F977421F1.description:
Demonstrate cultural literacy and familiarity with the great works and authors of the world and in particular the
Western canon.

F0EFBD91CDC04F33B6DE54822A5A1119.description:
Summarize how literature can reflect the historical and sociological culture of the time period in which it was
written and help better understand ourselves and other cultures and times.

3A66FB9107594642A71D7F8EAF4A7782.description:
Analyze how literature helps identify, interpret, and assimilate the cultural patrimony handed down from previous
generations.

C544D0FAD8E1495EA65DE9E3534262D0.description:
Evaluate complex literary selections for all that is implied in the concept of “person”  as defined from a Catholic
perspective.

BAC04A163C124544BC3AA04B301DEE13.description: Explain how literature assists in transcending the limited horizon of human reality.

65AA5F1F21E24956B4A28756D6ECA98A.description:
Use imagination to create dialogue between the reader and fictional characters by entering into the lives of the
characters and uncovering deeper meanings, inferences, and relationships between the characters, nature, and
God.

E60EED33592049E6885CEF86CBD40310.description:
Analyze critical values presented in literature and the degree to which they are in accord or discord with Catholic
norms.

A00E5F183D9F4AF9A5C01CBE13A04D39.description: Describe how poets and writers use language to convey truths that are universal and transcendent.

3F267B156A7E4A52AD6747E1A3F21E62.description:
Explain from a Catholic perspective how literature addresses critical questions related to man, such as: How ought
men live in community with each other? What are an individual’s rights, duties, freedoms, and restraints? What
are a society’s? What is the relationship between man and God? Between man and the physical world? What is the
nature of human dignity and the human spirit? What is love? What is the good life?

CB097B93AFC74E18BA9E44A2BF6059FE.description:
Describe the importance of thinking with images informed by classic Christian and Western symbols and
archetypes, including their important role in understanding the battle between good and evil and their role in
making visible realities that are complex, invisible, and spiritual.

698051C8610E45C182F37DA476BF6C63.description:
Describe how the rich spiritual knowledge communicated through fairy tales, fables, myths, parables, and other
stories is a reflection on the truth and development of a moral imagination and the mystery, danger, and wonder of
human experience.

702A12BB2B0A46D7B576E3C04D5FB5DE.description:
Identify how literature interprets the human condition, human behaviors, and human actions in its redeemed and
unredeemed state.

37A4B69A633D4E4797C8A01C1A7FA210.description: Share how literature can contribute to strengthening one’s moral character.

DBD41E96FC1346B69F39CE62873A9394.description:
Analyze carefully chosen selections to uncover the proper nature of man, his problems, and his experiences in
trying to know and perfect both himself and the world.

92F9D268B03F4F9BBF5E9184974F3839.description: Analyze works of fiction and non-fiction to uncover authentic Truth.

D94D3F8BF5F2499383984D16E36BE72A.description: Analyze literature that reflects the transmission of a Catholic culture and worldview.
